column4:
1. The youths are pushed back from any major role so old ideas which do not work anymore are being recycled
2. We have never really gained independence because international communities are comfortable with the crises since it benefits them
3. Monopoly of power, although common elsewhere is of topmost concern to its citizens.
4. Nothing has been done about the brutal killings of people in the North, up until some days ago where people were being burned alive and they made a video of it
5. If the people react to this injustice, they are killed or humiliated.

We do not have a country, hence politics are just mere words to me for now. The politics done is just mere feudalism

column4:
Right now Nigeria's political situation is filled with lack of trust and serious confusion.
The current party in government has failed woefully yet it constantly lie about its success.
There is serious economics downturn, many foreign investors have left the country and indigenous investors have and relocating to neighbouring countries.
Monetary policy and fiscal policy is on the verge of crashing.
Security is almost non existent 'you are on your own'. The security system is antipeople and are involved in killing their own people for money and in support of criminals.
Insurgency in every part.
Terrorism everywhere
Banditry, kidnapping, Fulani herdmen killings and farm destruction are going on unchecked and supported due to tribalism.
Infrastructures are basically on papers and in politicians mouth.
Regional agitation for self governance is very strong.
Serious stealing of public fund.
In summary, political situation is that of nothing to write home about and seemingly hopeless.
We are not giving up though.
column6:
To put the people above self.
Build infrastructures.
Invest in education.
Work on security.
column7:
Devolution of power. Too much power is the hands of too few people.
Devolution of resources and public fund. Too few people control the resources and public fund.
Leaders must avoid tribalism, nepotism and religious dominance.
Professionalism in place of mediocrity.

Educated Nigerians are at receiving end of bad governance.

column4:
Nigeria politics is best regarded as Beaurocracy rather than democracy. Most times, highly influential people feed their kits and kins into positions. In most cases, election has yet to yield the result of the majority. 

On the part of the citizens, lack of trust in the political systems, and the public servants, has led to apathy, especially among youths.  This however  has further complicated outcome of election where massive purchase of vote has become the norm.

Political aspirants must wine and dine with Godfathers and notorious louts, especially among the leaders of the national transport works if they want to win. The consequence of which is the appointment of incompetent cabinet members after election.

Parties lack stable ideologies and principles. So it's a normal for politicians to crosscarpet from one party to another, a save haven when the party weeds the stick.

In a nutshell, most Nigerians elite has lost hope in the Nigerian political systems.

column4:
Well, no tangible progress has been recorded. Perhaps, there are more sycophants in politics than the good ones.

Inconsistent policies and lack of continuities from one regime to the others obviously is contributing to the issues.

Nevertheless, the followers also contribute to the issues. Many keep selling their votes for small amount of money. Also, masses mostly lose trust in the government so quick and thus non compliance of many citizens to policies and unnecessary criticisms from all and sundry distract the government and keep development stagnant or less efficient.

Corruption is a command practice in virtually all sectors if not all household. This is really painful but factual.

Going forward, The government should set a reasonable and realistic targets. Sensitize the citizens effectively on the benefits of the policies.

We hope for better Nigeria ahead

column4:
Political situation in Nigeria cannot be understood in isolation without considering the interests and fears of all stakeholders from the colonial era till the introduction of democratic
rule. Some salient factors from my own perspective responsible for the present pathetic state of the nation are as listed: 1. Misunderstanding of power and authority by most leaders.
2. Lack of vision by leaders. 
3. Greed.
4. Self centeredness.

column4:
Nigeria politics has been  detrimental for the past 10 years. Most have seen politics as pot of delicious, wherein they give what it takes to attain power ,so as to sit on the delicacies. Government don't really  concern about citizen anymore but the supporting party members . They have turn the country to a game field, withholding  peoples right till time of election before giving it to them ,after many time starvation, so as to look as kindness.
Nigerians today are not enjoying any basic amenities  to average level.

Besides, parliamentary arms either the senate or Reps  should be slashed .

With the current situation  of Nigeria, military  government  will solve most of the problems.  If there can be agreement of transition  of power to military government for period  of time perhaps in some  particular state or nationwide.
